p: Figures 3A and 3F showed the predicted area of distribution for N. jatamansi and N. chinensis by the Maxent model under the current climate conditions. The simulation output results from the Maxent software are between zero and one. According to a previously published article by Wang et al. (2014), the results were divided into four levels: 0–0.05, 0.05–0.25, 0.25–0.5, and 0.5–1. Elith et al. (2011) considered that the average probability of species being present in suitable areas was 0.5. For the two species in this study, the area with probabilities above 0.5 was the main natural distribution area. Thus, the probabilities above 0.5 was defined as suitable habitats, and probabilities less than 0.5 were unsuitable based on the study of Wang et al. (2018).
